titleStmt.title: Two ordinances of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament: the one, for exempting the University of Cambridge from taxations. The other, for the regulating of the said university by the Earle of Manchester, and to remove scandalous ministers; providing a fifth part of their estates for their wives and children. Die Veneris 12. April 1645. Ordered by the Lords assembled in Parliament, that these ordinances be forthwith printed and published. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

titleStmt.title: Two ordinances of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament: the one, for exempting the University of Cambridge from taxations. The other, for the regulating of the said university by the Earle of Manchester, and to remove scandalous ministers; providing a fifth part of their estates for their wives and children. Die Veneris 12. April 1645. Ordered by the Lords assembled in Parliament, that these ordinances be forthwith printed and published. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Wright in the old Bayley,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
